title: Ticket #3146: 5.3.1.4 is out of date
description:
It says: 

  5.3.1.4 Current Limitations in Condor-C


  Submitting jobs to run under the grid universe has not yet been perfected. The following is a list of known limitations with Condor-C:
Authentication methods other than CLAIMTOBE, such as GSI and KERBEROS, are untested, and may not yet work.

GSI at least is known to work at this point, right?
remarks:
2012-Aug-01 11:07:27 by jfrey:
GSI, Kerberos, SSL, and Filesystem authentication all work with Condor-C. Pool password won't work, at least not to distinguish between users.
2012-Aug-23 14:11:52 by zmiller:
Bulk change of target version from v070802 to v070803 using ./ticket-target-mover.
check_ins: 2012-Aug-01 11:34   Check-in [32934]: update info about authentication methods that work with condor-c ===GT=== #3146 (By Karen Miller )
creator: pfc
